intro: Alyxia clusiophylla, commonly known as the clustered alyxia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pink flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a glossy, dark green appearance. Alyxia clusiophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
